description: In February, Canada launched a program help the immediate family members of Canadian citizens and permanent residents. As of Wednesday, not a single person has arrived in Canada, or even been approved to come.
title: A Canadian man tried for months to get his sister out of war-torn Sudan. She died waiting

description: An international law enforcement operation has dismantled encrypted communication platform, Ghost, notorious for enabling large-scale drug trafficking and money laundering, marking a significant blow to global organized crime networks.
title: A Canadian has been arrested in global crackdown on the Ghost encrypted app. Here's how it works

description: Conservatives are denying any association with protesters who harassed Jagmeet Singh, among others, outside of Parliament Hill this week after Liberal ministers accused them of lending their suppor
title: Conservatives deny links to protesters who harassed Singh on Parliament Hill

description: Salvatore "Totò" Schillaci, the Italy striker who was top scorer at the 1990 World Cup that his country hosted and epitomized a player exceeding expectations on soccer's biggest stage, has died. He was 59.
title: Salvatore 'Totò' Schillaci, the Italy striker who was top scorer at 1990 World Cup, dies at 59

description: Chrissy Isaacs is among the thousands who marched to Queen's Park in Toronto on Wednesday to demand action to help people in Grassy Narrows First Nation who've been impacted by mercury poisoning of their water. "I feel angry.This is an issue that's been ongoing for over 50 years," says Isaacs, one of the organizers of a caravan as part of the Walk for Mercury Justice.
title: Thousands rally outside Ontario Legislature to demand action on mercury poisoning in Grassy Narrows

description: Balloons are among the 12 toys under consideration for induction to the U.S. National Toy Hall of Fame this hall.
title: Inflated expectations? Could balloons get Toy Hall of Fame nod in 2024?

description: Alberta's government will build up to 30 new public schools, modernize five older schools and fund five charter school construction projects annually for three years, starting next year, cabinet ministers say.
title: Alberta government promises to build 90 new schools by 2031

description: A fifth staff member of a Saskatoon private Christian school has been charged with assaulting a student. CBC News has also learned that Valour Academy gave the accused a school "courage" award in the weeks following the alleged assault, and that she was working as a teacher but is not certified.
title: Assault charges laid against another staff member of Sask. private Christian school

description: Baby hippo Moo Deng has a massive following on social media, prompting fans to visit her in droves at a Thai zoo.
title: IN PHOTOS | Meet Moo Deng, social media's favourite baby hippo

description: More than 100 wildfires stretched thousands of firefighters to the limit in northern Portugal on Wednesday, with seven deaths since the worst spate of fires in recent years spread out of control over the weekend.
title: Portugal declares state of calamity as wildfires rage on

description: A 50-year-old story of UFOs at a farm near Langenburg, Sask. — a town 220 kilometres west of Regina — is being celebrated by Canada Post and the Canadian Royal Mint with a new coin.
title: Commemorative coin rekindles talk of 50-year-old alleged UFO sighting in rural Saskatchewan

description: Canada abstained today from a high-profile United Nations vote demanding that Israel end its "unlawful presence" in the Gaza Strip and the occupied West Bank within a year.
title: Canada abstains from UN motion calling on Israel to end occupation of Gaza, West Bank

description: Rising British metal stars Green Lung thrilled a sold-out audience in Toronto Tuesday for the band’s first-ever show in the city — but on this night, the crowd’s biggest round of applause might not have been for the band at all.
title: Onstage marriage proposal at metal concert thrills sold-out Toronto crowd

description: The Federal Reserve cut interest rates by half of a percentage point on Wednesday, kicking off what is expected to be a steady easing of monetary policy with a larger-than-usual reduction in borrowing costs that followed growing unease about the health of the job market.
title: U.S. Federal Reserve cuts interest rates by half a percentage point
Canada further reducing the number of international student permits

description: The teenage girl accused of seriously injuring a classmate by lighting her on fire at Evan Hardy Collegiate in Saskatoon is facing a new charge. The Crown added a charge of “unlawfully causing bodily harm” in connection to injuries suffered by a man involved in the Sept. 5 incident.
title: Crown adds new charge for girl, 14, accused of setting classmate on fire at Saskatoon high school

description: Ontario's Minister of Sport Neil Lumsden said Wednesday he intends to one day donate his brain for concussion research, while announcing new funding for a provincewide study on traumatic brain injuries.
title: Ontario's minister of sport, a former CFL player, says he will donate his brain for concussion research

description: Tupperware Brands, the company that revolutionized food storage decades ago and saw exponential growth with Tupperware parties, has filed for bankruptcy after years of financial woes and slumping sales due to cheap online competition.
title: Tupperware files for Chapter 11 bankruptcy

description: Researchers are recommending that more race-based data be collected about family caregivers who are Black, Indigenous and newcomers to Canada, after respondents in an online survey reported there aren't enough accessible supports for marginalized caregivers.
title: Caregiving 'an undervalued labour of love,' says charity exec urging more support for marginalized caregivers

description: Washington state is closing its death chamber this week, but South Carolina is scheduled to carry out its first execution since 2011. It's a reflection of the differing opinions in the U.S. on capital punishment.
title: As another U.S. state closes its execution chamber, Trump muses about expanding use of death penalty

description: Another man involved in the French rape trial that has shocked people around the world has admitted to drugging and raping his own wife, which legal and sociological experts say highlights the problematic and pervasive attitude that a husband owns his wife — and her body.
title: Copycat in Dominique Pelicot rape trial admits to drugging and raping his own wife — with help

description: Federal Transport Minister Pablo Rodriguez is expected to resign from cabinet in order to seek the leadership of the Liberal Party of Quebec, CBC News and Radio-Canada sources say.
title: Pablo Rodriguez to resign from cabinet, seek Quebec Liberal leadership: sources

description: Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre will table a motion of non-confidence next Tuesday to try and trigger a federal election.
title: Poilievre will introduce non-confidence motion next week to trigger election

description: On Dec. 22, 2023, Mathis Boivin, 15, died after overdosing on nitazene, a synthetic opioid five times stronger than fentanyl. His father, Christian Boivin said he felt “a lot of emotion” when he received a call from police announcing arrests tied to the death of his son.
title: Montreal police charge 2 people in connection with 15-year-old's overdose death

description: Meta's more restrictive Instagram accounts for teens are a good start in building a safer experience for young users, but experts say the suite of new rules also raise further questions about what more social media companies will do to protect youth.
title: Instagram's new teen accounts add protections. Experts say it's not enough

description: Bell has sold its stake in Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment, the company that owns the Toronto Maple Leafs and Toronto Raptors, to Rogers Communications for $4.7 billion.
title: Bell sells its stake in MLSE to Rogers for $4.7B

description: Rogers Communications has bought Bell out of its stake in Maple Leaf Sports & Entertainment, the company that owns the Toronto Maple Leafs and Toronto Raptors, for $4.7 billion.
title: Rogers to become majority owner of MLSE after buying Bell's stake for $4.7B

description: A former Memphis police officer testified Tuesday that he punched a "helpless" Tyre Nichols at least five times while two colleagues held his arms and said "hit him," then lied to his supervisor about their use of force in a beating that proved fatal.
title: Former Memphis police officer admits beating 'helpless' Tyre Nichols, shedding his bodycam

description: Taiwan's Gold Apollo said Wednesday the pagers used in the detonations in Lebanon had not been made by it but by a company called BAC, which has a licence to use its brand.<
title: Taiwan's Gold Apollo says it did not make pagers used in Lebanon blasts

description: The Canadian Medical Association will issue a formal apology for harms the medical profession has caused to First Nations, Inuit and Métis peoples.
title: CMA to hold ceremony to apologize for harms to Indigenous Peoples

description: On Sept. 18, 2022, Jibin Benoy, who was studying at Fanshawe Co
title: India's stats on student deaths in Canada sit heavily on family of London hit-and-run victim

description: Multiple RSV vaccines for adults are rolling out in the months ahead, along with two monoclonal antibody shots to provide protection for infants. How you access the various shots will depend on where you live, with some provinces covering certain options and not others.
title: Canada approved multiple RSV shots to ward off infections this fall — here's how to get them

description: For weeks, Conservative Leader Pierre Poilievre has been accusing NDP Leader Jagmeet Singh of supporting the government until February so he can become eligible for his MP pension. But experts estimate the size of Poilievre's own pension at more than three times that of Singh's pension.
title: Conservatives are targeting Singh over his pension — but Poilievre's is three times larger

description: Ali Hijazi’s brother was beaten to death in the Rivière-des-Prairies detention centre in Montreal last week, and now he wants answers.
title: Family demands answers after man slated for release beaten to death in Quebec jail

description: When Rizk Tafesh lost his left leg in an Israeli airstrike on June 21, he thought he'd never be able to stand on both legs again. That changed on Tuesday, when he was fitted for a prosthetic leg.
title: Gaza man's 'soul returned to life' upon getting new prosthetic leg

description: In Norfolk County, Hamilton and Burlington in Ontario, teams are working to control invasive dog-strangling vine, Japanese knotweed and the hemlock woolly adelgid, among other non-native species.
title: How teams in the Hamilton area are fighting dog-strangling vine and other invasive species

description: As a psychologist, Amy Green is seeing an uptick in clients experiencing climate anxiety. She teaches them techniques to help them cope — and in turn, they inspire her on her own healing journey.
title: I'm a therapist. In helping people deal with their climate anxiety, I'm learning to manage my own

description: Residents of an encampment in Kingston, Ont., say the two men who were killed there last week didn't see eye to eye, nor even like each other very much, but that didn't stop one from running to the other's aid when the violence broke out.
title: Victims of Kingston attack remembered as 'incredibly selfless'
